meanings.definition: To apply a new coat of paint or other material to something.
meanings.sent1: She recoated the fence to make it look fresh.
meanings.sent2: The workers recoated the walls with a bright color.
meanings.sent3: After the paintball fight, they recoated themselves in colorful splatters.
meanings.sent4: The artist recoated the canvas with vibrant strokes of paint.
meanings.sent5: He recoated the old chair, transforming it into a colorful masterpiece.

meanings.sent1: The recoated table gleamed under the sunlight.
meanings.sent2: The recoated car looked brand new.
meanings.sent3: The recoated puppy wagged its tail happily.
meanings.sent4: The recoated walls brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The recoated roof shone after the renovation.
